title: Promise.all() - Parallel Execution
description: Run multiple promises in parallel with Promise.all()
instructions:
Write an async function `fetchMultipleUsers(userIds)` that takes an array of user IDs and fetches all users in parallel. Each user fetch should simulate a 50ms delay and return { id: userId, name: 'User' + userId }.

Return an array of all user objects in the same order as the input IDs.

Example: fetchMultipleUsers([1, 2, 3]) should return [{ id: 1, name: 'User1' }, { id: 2, name: 'User2' }, { id: 3, name: 'User3' }]

hints.content: Use array.map() to create a promise for each user ID, then use Promise.all() to wait for all of them.
Map over userIds to create an array of promises. Each promise should setTimeout for 50ms then resolve with the user object. Pass the array to Promise.all().
Create promises array with map, then: `return Promise.all(promises);`. Each promise: `new Promise((resolve) => { setTimeout(() => { resolve({ id, name: 'User' + id }); }, 50); })`
